description: Map incidents triggered after battles (leaving_battle context). 11 total incidents.

events.title: Dead Man's Purse
events.setup: The battle is over. Bodies are scattered across the field. You notice a glint of gold on a corpse near your feet—someone's purse, spilled open. Officers aren't looking this way. No one would know.

options.resultText: You pocket the coins quickly, glancing around. No one saw. The weight feels heavier than it should.
options.tooltip: Risky choice. Adds 2 scrutiny. 25 gold reward.

options.resultText: You step over the body and move on. Some things aren't worth the risk—or the guilt.
options.tooltip: Safe choice. Honor trait XP.

options.text: Report the find to an officer
options.resultText: An officer nods and pockets the purse himself. He slips you a few coins for your honesty. 'Good soldier,' he mutters.
options.tooltip: +5 Officer rep. 5 gold reward.

events.title: The Wounded Enemy
events.setup: A wounded enemy soldier lies in the mud, blood pooling beneath him. He's watching you, eyes wide with fear and pain. He's not dead yet. No one else is around.

options.resultText: You draw your blade and finish it quickly. Mercy or cruelty—you're not sure which. The field is quieter now.
options.tooltip: Safe choice. Valor and Mercy trait XP.

options.resultText: You walk away. His labored breathing fades behind you. He might live, he might not. That's not your decision to make.
options.tooltip: Safe choice. Mercy trait XP.

options.resultText: You signal for the surgeon's assistant. He looks at you oddly but comes over. 'Strange to waste bandages on them,' he says, but he does it anyway.
options.tooltip: Requires Medicine 20. +2 Officer rep, -3 Soldier rep. Mercy trait XP.

events.title: The First Kill
events.setup: You stare at your hands, still trembling. The blood isn't yours. You remember the moment—the shock on his face, the way he fell. If this was your first, it's hitting you now.

options.resultText: You find a quiet spot and sit for a long moment, staring at nothing. Something has changed in you. The trembling stops. When you stand, you're different—harder, maybe, but steadier. This is what you came here to become.
options.tooltip: Reflect on kill. Train OneHanded. Valor and Honor trait XP.

options.resultText: You shake your head and force your legs to carry you forward. There's no time for this. Not here, not now. You bury it deep, with all the other things you don't think about. It works. For now.
options.tooltip: Safe choice. Calculating trait XP. Adds 1 medical risk.

options.resultText: An older soldier sees the look on your face and nods. 'First one's the hardest,' he says quietly. 'Gets easier. Shouldn't, but it does.' You don't feel better, but you feel less alone.
options.tooltip: +5 Soldier rep. Boosts company morale.

events.title: The Captain's Eye
events.setup: As you clean your blade, the captain approaches. 'You fought well today,' he says, loud enough for others to hear. Men are watching. Public recognition from an officer is rare.

options.resultText: 'Just doing my duty, sir.' The captain nods approvingly. Some of the men exchange glances—respect, maybe, or jealousy.
options.tooltip: +8 Officer rep, +3 Soldier rep.

options.resultText: 'Thank you, sir. I've trained hard for moments like this.' The captain smiles slightly. The other soldiers are less impressed with your ego.
options.tooltip: +10 Officer rep, -5 Soldier rep.

options.resultText: 'We all did our part, sir. The men beside me earned this recognition as much as I did.' The soldiers grin. The captain looks thoughtful.
options.tooltip: Requires Charm 30. +5 Officer rep, +10 Soldier rep. Generosity trait XP.

events.title: Fallen Comrade
events.setup: Someone you knew is dead. Not well, perhaps—a face from the campfire, a voice from the march—but dead all the same. Burial detail is forming. They could use another pair of hands.

options.resultText: You dig alongside the others in silence. The work is hard, but it feels right. These men deserve better than a shallow pit.
options.tooltip: Help with burial. +8 Soldier rep. Boosts company morale.

options.resultText: You stand at a distance, watching the detail work. You say nothing, but someone notices you there. It's enough.
options.tooltip: Pay respects. +3 Soldier rep. Honor trait XP.

options.text: Move on, there's work to do
options.resultText: You turn away. Death is part of this life. Sentiment won't bring them back, and the living need attention too.
options.tooltip: -3 Soldier rep. Calculating trait XP.

events.title: Battlefield Discovery
events.setup: While sifting through the aftermath, you notice something valuable half-buried in the mud—a well-crafted weapon, a noble's signet ring, or a pouch of foreign coin. It's worth more than a soldier's pay for a month.

options.resultText: You slip the item into your pack, covering it with a torn cloak. Your heart pounds, but no one saw. You hope.
options.tooltip: Risky choice. Adds 3 scrutiny. 80 gold reward.

options.text: Turn it in to the quartermaster
options.resultText: The quartermaster weighs the item in his hand, impressed. 'Honest work gets rewarded,' he says, and gives you a share of the value—less than it's worth, but clean coin.
options.tooltip: +8 Officer rep, -2 Scrutiny. 30 gold reward.

options.text: Hide it and sell it in town later
options.resultText: You know a merchant who won't ask questions. You tuck the item away, planning your next visit to town. This could be profitable.
options.tooltip: Requires Roguery 30. Dangerous choice. 120 gold reward. Adds 5 scrutiny.

events.title: Call for Medics
events.setup: Wounded are screaming across the field. The surgeon is overwhelmed, moving from body to body. He sees you and calls out—another pair of hands could save lives.

options.resultText: You kneel in the blood and mud, doing what you can. Some you save. Some you can't. The surgeon nods at you when it's over—the highest praise he ever gives.
options.tooltip: Train Medicine. +10 Soldier rep. Mercy trait XP.

options.resultText: You can't heal, but you can lift. You haul wounded men to the surgeon's tent until your arms burn. Lives are saved because you were strong enough.
options.tooltip: Train Athletics. +8 Soldier rep. Mercy trait XP.

options.text: Move on, it's not your duty
options.resultText: You pretend not to hear and keep walking. The surgeon's stare follows you. Some things are someone else's problem.
options.tooltip: -5 Soldier rep. -5 Mercy trait XP.

events.title: Enemy Documents
events.setup: A dead officer lies in a ditch, his satchel spilled open. Papers flutter in the wind—maps, orders, possibly valuable intelligence. You could take them to your lord, or you could see what they say first.

options.resultText: You gather the papers and bring them to the captain. His eyes widen as he reads. 'Good work, soldier. The lord will hear about this.'
options.tooltip: Train Scouting. +10 Lord rep, +8 Officer rep.

options.resultText: You scan the documents quickly—troop movements, supply routes, a name that might matter. Knowledge is power. You bring them to the captain, keeping what you learned to yourself.
options.tooltip: Requires Scouting 50. Moderate risk. Train Scouting. +8 Lord rep.

options.resultText: You pocket the papers without a word. This information could be worth something to the right buyer. Or it could get you killed.
options.tooltip: Dangerous choice. Adds 4 scrutiny. Intelligence has value.

events.title: Battle Trophy
events.setup: A fallen enemy carried a fine blade, an ornate helmet, or a banner worth keeping. You could take it as a trophy—a memento of what you survived today.

options.resultText: You claim the item and attach it to your gear. Other soldiers nod with approval—a warrior's right to spoils.
options.tooltip: Claim trophy. +5 Soldier rep. Valor trait XP.

options.resultText: You leave the item where it lies. The dead deserve their dignity, and you don't need trinkets to remember this day.
options.tooltip: Safe choice. Honor and Mercy trait XP.

options.text: Give it to a comrade who fought harder
options.resultText: You press the trophy into a fellow soldier's hands. 'You earned this more than me.' His surprised gratitude is worth more than any trinket.
options.tooltip: Give to comrade. +10 Soldier rep. Generosity trait XP.

events.title: The Survivors
events.setup: A handful of enemy soldiers have surrendered—wounded, exhausted, and terrified. They sit in the mud, hands raised. Some of your comrades are eyeing them with dark intent. What happens next is up to those who have swords.

options.resultText: 'They surrendered. That means they're prisoners, not targets.' Your voice carries weight. The angry soldiers back off, and the prisoners are taken to the officers.
options.tooltip: Requires Leadership 40. Moderate risk. +8 Officer rep, -5 Soldier rep. Mercy and Honor trait XP.

options.text: Walk away and let it happen
options.resultText: You turn your back. What happens behind you is not your responsibility. The sounds fade quickly. War is ugly.
options.tooltip: Safe choice. Adds 1 discipline issues. -10 Mercy trait XP.

options.resultText: You step forward and do what needs doing. Quick, efficient, final. The men watch without comment. This is the reality of war.
options.tooltip: Dangerous choice. Adds 2 discipline issues, +3 Soldier rep. -20 Mercy trait XP.

events.title: Ambush!
events.setup: The battle seemed over, but enemy survivors rallied in the trees. Arrows fly, steel clashes—you're in the middle of a counter-attack. Men are going down around you.

options.resultText: 'Form up! Shields together!' Your voice cuts through the chaos. Men respond, forming a defensive line. The ambush falters against organized resistance.
options.tooltipTemplate: {CHANCE}% (Tactics {SKILL}). +30 Tactics XP, +20 Leadership XP, +15 Officer/+10 Soldier rep. Fail: -25 HP, -2 troops.
options.failure_resultText: You try to organize a defense, but the chaos is too complete. Men fall before they can respond. You take a wound yourself.

options.text: Fight your way back to the main force
options.resultText: You grab the nearest soldiers and push toward the main body. It's ugly, brutal, and some don't make it—but you survive.
options.failure_resultText: The retreat turns into a rout. You're wounded badly, and too many men fall before reaching safety.
options.tooltip: 60% success chance. Causes 10 damage and 1 troop loss. Failure causes 30 damage and 3 troop loss.

options.resultText: You plant your feet and fight whoever comes at you. The ambushers break when they realize you're not running. Your blade is slick with blood, but you're still standing.
options.failure_resultText: You're overwhelmed. A blade finds your side, and you go down. When you wake, the fighting is over, and the cost was high.
options.tooltipTemplate: {CHANCE}% (OneHanded {SKILL}). +20 OneHanded XP, +8 Soldier rep. Fail: -40 HP, -2 troops.
